page.title: 07Tan-y-Groes/Sarnau, Ecology
page.content: The area is relatively unspoilt by modern farming methods, and many species of{wild flower,}grass and shrub can be seen in the banks and hedgerows. The mild damp climate creates a lush flora. Snowdrops, primroses and cowslips are plentiful in spring, followed by wild orchids - early purple and spotted. Pennywort reaches large size in the banks. Dandelions, campion, geranium, harebells, foxgloves, clover, tansy and honeysuckle are followed by rosebay willowherb in autumn. Dog roses in various colours bloom all summer. Bracken in copses, and hartstongue and male{fern}are common. Primroses pollinated by primula species in local gardens produce flowers from pale yellow to red near habitation.
